author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an uppercase letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, ends in a lowercase letter. **Important note: It is okay to have a package name that ends in an uppercase letter. However, you will need to wait until a registry maintainer manually approves the name.**
- Name is not at least five characters long
- I was not able to install the package (i.e. `Pkg.add("BLP")` failed). See the CI logs for details.
- I was not able to load the package (i.e. `import BLP` failed). See the CI logs for details.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

* Naming: I assumed the name `BLPAPI` (or `Blpapi`) was taken by JuliaComputing, so I used BLP. This package does not have an obvious alternative name, and I accept suggestions.

* build fails: the CI tried to install on linux. Currently this is a Windows-only package in this initial release.

>     * build fails: the CI tried to install on linux. Currently this is a Windows-only package in this initial release.

That is fine.

>     * Naming: I assumed the name `BLPAPI` (or `Blpapi`) was taken by JuliaComputing, so I used BLP. This package does not have an obvious alternative name, and I accept suggestions.

I would **very strongly** recommend a longer and more descriptive package name.

How about:
- `Bloomberg.jl`
- `BloombergAPI.jl`
- `BloombergData.jl`
- `BloombergFinance.jl`
@DilumAluthge , I'm afraid those names are Bloomberg trademarks. Most packages go with Blpapi name.
Cool. I'll close this PR, and you can make a new registration after you have renamed the package.
